unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Type I Error: Efficiency Rating of a Boiler
question_text: A new boiler is being advertised to have an efficiency rate of $91\%$ .  The company's  competitor believes the new boiler is producing an efficiency rate of less than $91\%$ .  The company's competitor designs an experiment by randomly selecting 100 of the new boilers to test their efficiency rate. Under which of the following conditions would a Type I error be committed?

choices.text: The competitor's company concludes that the new boiler's efficiency rate is less than 91 % 91 % when it is actually 91 % 91 % .
The competitor's company concludes that the new boiler's efficiency rate is not less than 91 % 91 % when it is actually less than 91 % 91 % .
The competitor's company concludes that the new boiler's efficiency rate is 91 % 91 % when it is actually 91 % 91 % .
The competitor's company concludes that the new boiler's efficiency rate is less than 91 % 91 % when it is really less than 91 % 91 % .
A type I error cannot be committed in this situation.
